paper_summary:
See my previous summary.
After reading the authors' response, most questions and concerns are addressed.  The remaining concern I have is the instability of major PLMs (e.g., https://openreview.net/forum?id=nzpLWnVAyah), where PLMs are very sensitive to hyper-parameters both in pre-training and fine-tuning. 
This paper explores language abilities of PLM(s), but each PLM is based on a single hyper-parameter configuration (learning rate, batch size, number of updates etc.). Considering the instability of PLMs, my concern is that the findings of this paper might not be supported when we use different hyper-parameters (e.g., using different random seeds, learning rates, batch sizes).  It would be great to mention this phenomenon/possibility in the paper.
comments: I appreciate authors' response. I raised my score.
